title: [FR] sklearn serve model fails with custom function in FunctionTransformer

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

body:
## Willingness to contribute
No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Ubuntu 18.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.8.0
- **Python version**: 3.7.8

### Describe the problem
I built a sklearn pipeline that includes a FunctionTransformer. This FunctionTransformer is defined by a function that I created. I am able to log and save this sklearn pipeline in mlflow, however I am not able to serve it. There is an AttributeError message indicating that it cannot find the function that I created for the FunctionTransformer step in the pipeline. Here's an example below with the error message.

### Code to reproduce issue
```python

import mlflow
import mlflow.sklearn
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
from sklearn import tree
from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

iris = load_iris()
data = pd.DataFrame(data= np.c_[iris['data'], iris['target']],
                    columns= iris['feature_names'] + ['target'])
X = data[['sepal length (cm)', 'sepal width (cm)', 'petal length (cm)', 'petal width (cm)']]
y = iris["target"]


def custom_function(df):
    dataframe = df.apply(np.sqrt, axis=0)
    return dataframe

transformer = FunctionTransformer(custom_function)
sk_model = tree.DecisionTreeClassifier()
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[("preprocessor", transformer), 
                           ("classifier", sk_model)])

with mlflow.start_run():
    
    pipeline.fit(X, y)

    # log model
    mlflow.sklearn.log_model(pipeline, "sk_models", serialization_format='pickle')
```
```python
print(mlflow.sklearn.load_model("mlruns/0/610244b8f9b1423c9d1c49a51958b872/artifacts/sk_models"))
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor',
                 FunctionTransformer(func=<function custom_function at 0x7f15599a28c0>)),
                ('classifier', DecisionTreeClassifier())])
```
```python
!mlflow models serve -m runs:/610244b8f9b1423c9d1c49a51958b872/sk_models -p 1234
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2020/08/24 14:43:24 INFO mlflow.models.cli: Selected backend for flavor 'python_function'
2020/08/24 14:43:25 INFO mlflow.pyfunc.backend: === Running command 'source /opt/conda/bin/../etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36 1>&2 && gunicorn --timeout=60 -b 127.0.0.1:1234 -w 1 ${GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS} -- mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.wsgi:app'
[2020-08-24 14:43:25 +0000] [3510] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.0.4
[2020-08-24 14:43:25 +0000] [3510] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:1234 (3510)
[2020-08-24 14:43:25 +0000] [3510] [INFO] Using worker: sync

    worker.init_process()

    self.load_wsgi()
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 144, in load_wsgi
    self.wsgi = self.app.wsgi()
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 67, in wsgi

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 49, in load

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 39, in load_wsgiapp
    return util.import_app(self.app_uri)
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/util.py", line 358, in import_app
    mod = importlib.import_module(module)
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module

  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1006, in _gcd_import

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/wsgi.py", line 6, in <module>

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/__init__.py", line 473, in load_model

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/sklearn.py", line 332, in _load_pyfunc

AttributeError: Can't get attribute 'custom_function' on <module '__main__' from '/opt/conda/envs/mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36/bin/gunicorn'>

  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow_test_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow_test_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow_test_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/opt/conda/envs/mlflow_test_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke

Exception: Command 'source /opt/conda/bin/../etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate mlflow-10ac34ad0ee54ebbd0dc2d47e12f26a0de186e36 1>&2 && gunicorn --timeout=60 -b 127.0.0.1:1234 -w 1 ${GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS} -- mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.wsgi:app' returned non zero return code. Return code = 3
```

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- `area/server-infra`: MLflow server
